description: This thick, hearty meal is inspired by a traditional Provençal harvest soup Farro (spelt) and the softer emmer wheat are grains that were once peasant staples in the mountainous areas of Provence, though they are less common now Traditionally, the grain is simmered with a mutton, prosciutto or ham bone
title: Farro and Vegetable Soup
title_page: Farro and Vegetable Soup Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
This thick, hearty meal is inspired by a traditional Provençal harvest soup. Farro (spelt) and the softer emmer wheat are grains that were once peasant staples in the mountainous areas of Provence, though they are less common now. Traditionally, the grain is simmered with a mutton, prosciutto or ham bone. I use Parmesan rinds to enrich the flavor of this version.
Featured in: Soups With Grains.
Learn: How to Make Soup
